question.text:
The figure shows a section of the human ovary. Select the option which gives the correct identification of A, B, C.



(i) A is a group of primary follicles that gradually matures under the influence of LH and FSH.

(ii) C is the Graafian follicle which starts producing a hormone called progesterone.

(iii) C is a corpus luteum that secretes FSH.

(iv) B is the Graafian follicle which ruptures during mid of the cycle.

solution.text:
Corpus luteum, yellow hormone-secreting body in the female reproductive system that secretes progesterone which further maintains endometrium. Graafian follicle produce a hormone called estrogen by the follicular granulosa cells.

If fertilization does not occur, the corpus luteum involutes to form the corpus Albicans that is filled with fibrous tissue.
